help.title: Help
help.introDesc: Everything you need to know about syncing, backups, and keeping your accounts safe.
help.syncDesc: Ghost Auth syncs your codes between devices over a direct, encrypted connection. Both devices must be on the same network.
help.syncStep1: On the device that has the codes you want to share, go to Settings → Sync from this device. This will display a QR code.
help.syncStep2: On the device you want to receive the codes, go to Settings → Sync to this device and scan the QR code.
help.syncNote: Syncing is not automatic. Whenever you add, edit, or remove accounts, you'll need to sync again to keep your other devices up to date.
help.importDesc: You can import your existing codes from other authenticator apps like Google Authenticator, Authy, Microsoft Authenticator, and more.
help.importStep1Title: Step 1 — Export from your current app
help.importStep1: In your current authenticator app, look for an export or transfer option. This usually generates a QR code or an export file containing your accounts.
help.importStep2: Go to Settings → Import from app. Scan the QR code from your old app, or select the export file. Your accounts will be added to Ghost Auth.
help.backupExportDesc: Go to Settings → Export backup to save an encrypted file containing all of your accounts. Store this file in a safe, encrypted location of your choosing — such as a password manager, encrypted drive, or secure cloud storage.
help.backupImportDesc: Go to Settings → Import backup and select your previously exported backup file. Your accounts will be restored.
help.backupNote: We strongly recommend exporting backups regularly, especially before making changes to your accounts. Backups are currently stored locally — they are not hosted on Ghost Auth servers. User accounts and automated backups may be available in the future.
help.forgotPinDesc1: If you've forgotten your PIN code, you can use one of the recovery codes that were provided when you first set up your PIN. Each recovery code can only be used once.
help.forgotPinDesc2: If you no longer have your recovery codes, there is no way to unlock the app. Your only option is to reinstall Ghost Auth and import a backup file containing your previous accounts.
help.lostDeviceDesc: If you've lost your device, install Ghost Auth on a new device and import a backup file. If you had synced your accounts to another device, you can also sync from that device.
help.accessWarning: Ghost Auth has no user accounts and no server-side storage. If you lose complete access to the app and have no backup file or synced device, recovering your TOTP codes is impossible. Export backups regularly and store them securely.

help.title: > Help
help.syncingDesc: Sync your accounts from the Ghost Auth desktop or mobile app over a direct, encrypted connection. Both devices must be on the same network.
help.syncingStep: On your app, go to Settings → Sync from this device. Then in this extension, go to Settings → Sync from device and enter the sync code.
help.syncingNote: Syncing is manual — repeat whenever you add or change accounts in the app.
help.backupsExport: Export an encrypted .ghostauth backup file from Settings → Export backup. Store it somewhere safe.
help.backupsImport: Import a backup from Settings → Import backup. Backups are compatible between the app and extension.
help.masterPasswordDesc: Your vault is encrypted with a master password. This password never leaves your browser and cannot be recovered.
help.masterPasswordWarning: If you forget your master password, you'll need to reinstall the extension and import a backup or sync from the app.
help.pinRecoveryDesc: The optional PIN lock adds a quick-unlock layer on top of the master password. Recovery codes are provided when you set up a PIN — save them somewhere safe.
help.pinRecoveryNote: If you forget your PIN and have no recovery codes, lock the vault manually (close and reopen the browser) and use your master password instead.
help.losingAccessDesc: Ghost Auth has no user accounts and no server-side storage. If you lose access to both the extension and the app with no backup file, recovering your TOTP codes is impossible. Export backups regularly.
